datasets.name: e597d72c
datasets.query:
select ts, count(1) nbFraudTransactions, sum(amount) sumFraudTransactions--, label 
from(
    select from_unixtime(unix_timestamp(current_timestamp()) + (step * 3600)) ts, amount--, label
    from `main__build`.`dbdemos_fsi_fraud_detection`.gold_transactions
    join (--just getting the last 30 days
        select max(step)-(24*30) windowStart, max(step) windowEnd 
        from `main__build`.`dbdemos_fsi_fraud_detection`.gold_transactions
    ) on step >= windowStart and step <= windowEnd
    where is_fraud
) group by ts--, label
order by ts

datasets.name: 7a31791d
datasets.query:
SELECT 
    countryOrig, 
    countryDest, 
    type, 
    value,
    CASE 
        WHEN countryOrig < countryDest THEN countryOrig || '-' || countryDest 
        ELSE countryDest || '-' || countryOrig 
    END AS countries_combined
FROM (
    SELECT 
        countryOrig, 
        countryDest, 
        type, 
        COUNT(amount) AS value 
    FROM `main__build`.`dbdemos_fsi_fraud_detection`.gold_transactions
    WHERE amount > 350000
    GROUP BY countryOrig, countryDest, type
) 
ORDER BY countries_combined, value DESC
LIMIT 20

--in terms of number of transactions
--russia making / receiving more transactions > 350000, than othr countries
--most these transactions are transfer

datasets.name: 720bedbf
datasets.query:
select * from (
    select nameOrig , count(1) as nbTransactions 
    from `main__build`.`dbdemos_fsi_fraud_detection`.gold_transactions
    join (--just getting the last 30 days
        select max(step)-(24*30) windowStart, max(step) windowEnd 
        from `main__build`.`dbdemos_fsi_fraud_detection`.gold_transactions
    ) on step >= windowStart and step <= windowEnd
    where is_fraud
    group by nameOrig
) 
order by nbTransactions desc
limit 1

datasets.name: 6fef3cee
datasets.query:
select * from (
    select nameDest , count(1) as nbTransactions 
    from `main__build`.`dbdemos_fsi_fraud_detection`.gold_transactions
    join (--just getting the last 30 days
        select max(step)-(24*30) windowStart, max(step) windowEnd 
        from `main__build`.`dbdemos_fsi_fraud_detection`.gold_transactions
    ) on step >= windowStart and step <= windowEnd
    where is_fraud
    group by nameDest
) 
order by nbTransactions desc
limit 1

datasets.name: 59d6afc3
datasets.query:
select countryOrig , countryDest , type, value from (
    select countryOrig , countryDest , type, sum(amount ) as value from `main__build`.`dbdemos_fsi_fraud_detection`.gold_transactions
    where is_fraud and amount > 350000
    group by countryOrig , countryDest ,type
) order by value desc
limit 100

datasets.name: ec5b3150
datasets.query:
select count(1) as nbTransactions 
    from `main__build`.`dbdemos_fsi_fraud_detection`.gold_transactions
    join (--just getting the last 30 days
        select max(step)-(24*30) windowStart, max(step) windowEnd 
        from `main__build`.`dbdemos_fsi_fraud_detection`.gold_transactions
    ) on step >= windowStart and step <= windowEnd
    where is_fraud

widget.name: 494f99ac
widget.textbox_spec:
### Observations
In terms of number of >$350k transactions :
- Russia is initiating / receiving more transactions, than any other country
- Most these transactions are transfers

widget.name: d7f865c4
widget.textbox_spec:
# Fraud Analysis on the Data Intelligence Platform

Existing Fraud Analysis ingested in our Data Intelligence Platform

This data is then used by our Data Scientists to build a ML model and evaluate transaction risk to provide real-time Fraud Detection capabilities.

widget.name: afa88728
widget.textbox_spec:
### DBDemos dashboard
This dataset is was generated in most part using a [PaySim](https://github.com/EdgarLopezPhD/PaySim) mobile money simulator. It is thus entirely synthetic and does not represent real individuals and transactions.
![tracking_img](https://ppxrzfxige.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/v1/analytics?category=lakehouse&notebook=dashboard_fraud_detection&demo_name=lakehouse-fsi-fraud-detection&event=DASHBOARD_VIEW)
